title.text: How to Dine out With Your Celiac Child

summary.text: Parents who have children who suffer from Celiac disease may be hard pressed to find restaurants that offer healthy options for their children to safely consume. If a child with a gluten allergy consumes wheat, even in small doses, either intentionally or accidentally, it can cause serious health problems.
Gluten affects the intestines of Celiac patients by preventing them from absorbing crucial nutrients and causing nausea, fatigue and severe diarrhea.
If you want to eat out with your Celiac child, there are some important steps you can follow to facilitate a safe dining experience away from the home.

step.em: Bring a detailed list of acceptable and prohibited foods with you to the restaurant.

details.text: Create a laminated list of foods that contain gluten for easy reference.

ul.li: Keeping this list on you at all times will ensure that you are ready to provide anyone with information about Celiac disease or gluten sensitivity

step.em: Go online and check the menu.

details.text: Some restaurants actually have gluten free options. But, this, of course, depends on the type of restaurant and food.

step.em: Ask for a hamburger with no bun!

details.text: You can do this at almost any place, just like asking for no mayo!

step.em: Ask about gluten-free options and ingredients.

ul.li: Call a restaurant twice before you visit with your gluten sensitive child. Make the first call several days ahead to see if the restaurant is a viable choice for your family, and call once again on the day you will be dining at the restaurant.
Notify the restaurant in advance about which day you will be eating out so that the management can be sure that gluten-free menu ingredients are available.
Do not let your child share food off of your plate as some of your food may be contaminated with gluten-containing food items.
Avoid cream sauces, cheese sauces, gravy, and all fried foods as these often contain flour which is used as a thickening agent or a crisp outer coating.
